CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Such high energy alignment would not enable to achieve a large open - circuit voltage and is eventually detrimental to the PCE output of PT - based PSCs such as in P3HT / PCBM systems with PCE ranging from 3 to 4% . 21,22 Geng and co-workers synthesized two PT - based donor materials by incorporating carboxylate side chains and vinylene linkers between thiophene units. The HOMO and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels of the resulting polymers , PBT and PTT , were substantially stabilized when compared to those of the parent P3HT. Such energy level lowering was attributed to the integration of carboxylate and vinylene groups giving rise to a push - pull structural motif , resulting in an enhanced PCE of the PV devices based on them. 21 Over the years , the use of the structural effect to enhance PSC performance has been extensively investigated , particularly the donor - acceptor ( D-A ) strategy , which has been proved to be an effective approach to develop donor polymers with wide absorption , low - lying energy levels , and enhanced electron properties. 23-32 Besides , conjugation expansion on the polymer backbone is an alternative tool to improve the electronic properties of polymers. By replacing a branched 2ethylhexyl side chain with a linear n-octyl group , Zhang and his co-workers synthesized a PTB7-Th derivative namely , PBTT. PV cells based on PBTT : IEICO showed a superior device performance than that of the PTB7-Th - based device with a PCE of 9.5% , a V oc of 0.86 V , a J sc of 17.9 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 61.3% . Such dramatic enhancement in efficiency was attributed to a higher charge mobility and improved morphology of the PBTT : IEICO blend film induced by the less steric hindered linear alkyl side chain. 1 Yang and coworkers used selenophene to replace thiophene π-bridge in the indacenodithiophene (IDT)-benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c′]dithiophene-4,8-dione (BDD)-based copolymer ( PThBDDIDT ) to develop a donor-π-acceptor type copolymer , PSeBDDIDT. The PCE of solar cells based on polymer : PC71BM as an active layer was dramatically increased from 7.04 to 8.65% , respectively. Such improvement could result from stronger intermolecular interactions , expanded absorption range , and better molecular planarity of selenophene contained PSeBDDIDT. 33 Random terpolymers comprised of thieno[2′,3′ : 5′,6′]pyrido [ 3,4- g]- thieno[3,2-c]isoquinoline-5,11(4H,10H)-dione , thiophene( T ) , and dithiophene ( 2T ) were synthesized by Yang and co-workers in which the crystallinity of terpolymers could be controlled by varying the compositions of T and 2T. The PSC based on a terpolymer with the optimized T / 2T ratio of 7 : 3 showed a high J sc of 18.3 mA cm^-2 and a FF of 71.2% , thus resulting in an enhanced PCE up to 10.8% . 34 Fluorination on polymer backbones has also been widely adopted to tune and improve the functional properties of donor polymers such as stabilization of their energy levels and hence positively impacting on PSC performance.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. P3HT: Mentioned in the paragraph as a PT-based donor material.
2. PCBM: Mentioned in the paragraph as a PT-based donor material.
3. PBT: A PT-based donor material synthesized by Geng and co-workers.
4. PTT: Another PT-based donor material synthesized by Geng and co-workers.
5. PTB7-Th: A PT-based donor material mentioned as a reference material.
6. PBTT: A PTB7-Th derivative synthesized by Zhang and co-workers.
7. PSeBDDIDT: A donor-π-acceptor type copolymer synthesized by Yang and co-workers.
8. T: Thieno[2',3':5',6']pyrido[3,4-g]thieno[3,2-c]isoquinoline-5,11(4H,10H)-dione.
9. 2T: Thiophene.
10. 7 : 3: The composition ratio of T and 2T in the terpolymer.

These are the "Material Name" entities mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the Material Name entities in the paragraph:

1. P3HT
2. PCBM
3. PBT
4. PTT
5. PBTT

These are the Material Names mentioned in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the Material Name entities in the paragraph presented as a Markdown table:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| P3HT |
| PCBM |
| PBT |
| PTT |
| PBTT |

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Such high energy alignment would not enable to achieve a large open - circuit voltage and is eventually detrimental to the PCE output of PT - based PSCs such as in P3HT / PCBM systems with PCE ranging from 3 to 4% . 21,22 Geng and co-workers synthesized two PT - based donor materials by incorporating carboxylate side chains and vinylene linkers between thiophene units. The HOMO and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels of the resulting polymers , PBT and PTT , were substantially stabilized when compared to those of the parent P3HT. Such energy level lowering was attributed to the integration of carboxylate and vinylene groups giving rise to a push - pull structural motif , resulting in an enhanced PCE of the PV devices based on them. 21 Over the years , the use of the structural effect to enhance PSC performance has been extensively investigated , particularly the donor - acceptor ( D-A ) strategy , which has been proved to be an effective approach to develop donor polymers with wide absorption , low - lying energy levels , and enhanced electron properties. 23-32 Besides , conjugation expansion on the polymer backbone is an alternative tool to improve the electronic properties of polymers. By replacing a branched 2ethylhexyl side chain with a linear n-octyl group , Zhang and his co-workers synthesized a PTB7-Th derivative namely , PBTT. PV cells based on PBTT : IEICO showed a superior device performance than that of the PTB7-Th - based device with a PCE of 9.5% , a V oc of 0.86 V , a J sc of 17.9 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 61.3% . Such dramatic enhancement in efficiency was attributed to a higher charge mobility and improved morphology of the PBTT : IEICO blend film induced by the less steric hindered linear alkyl side chain. 1 Yang and coworkers used selenophene to replace thiophene π-bridge in the indacenodithiophene (IDT)-benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c′]dithiophene-4,8-dione (BDD)-based copolymer ( PThBDDIDT ) to develop a donor-π-acceptor type copolymer , PSeBDDIDT. The PCE of solar cells based on polymer : PC71BM as an active layer was dramatically increased from 7.04 to 8.65% , respectively. Such improvement could result from stronger intermolecular interactions , expanded absorption range , and better molecular planarity of selenophene contained PSeBDDIDT. 33 Random terpolymers comprised of thieno[2′,3′ : 5′,6′]pyrido [ 3,4- g]- thieno[3,2-c]isoquinoline-5,11(4H,10H)-dione , thiophene( T ) , and dithiophene ( 2T ) were synthesized by Yang and co-workers in which the crystallinity of terpolymers could be controlled by varying the compositions of T and 2T. The PSC based on a terpolymer with the optimized T / 2T ratio of 7 : 3 showed a high J sc of 18.3 mA cm^-2 and a FF of 71.2% , thus resulting in an enhanced PCE up to 10.8% . 34 Fluorination on polymer backbones has also been widely adopted to tune and improve the functional properties of donor polymers such as stabilization of their energy levels and hence positively impacting on PSC performance.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the property names of materials mentioned in the paragraph:

1. P3HT (Poly(3-hexylthiophene))
2. PCBM (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene))
3. PTBT (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythieno[3,4-c]pyrrole))
4. PBT (Poly(3-bromothieno[3,4-c]pyrrole))
5. PTT (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythieno[3,4-c]thiophene))
6. PTB7-Th (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythieno[3,4-c]pyrrole-co-3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene))
7. PBTT (Poly(3-bromothieno[3,4-c]pyrrole-co-3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene))
8. PSeBDDIDT (Poly(selenophene-co-benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c′]dithiophene-4,8-dione))
9. PThBDDIDT (Poly(thieno[2′,3′ : 5′,6′]pyrido[3,4-g]-thieno[3,2-c]isoquinoline-5,11(4H,10H)-dione-co-benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c′]dithiophene-4,8-dione))
10. T (Thieno[2′,3′ : 5′,6′]pyrido[3,4-g]-thieno[3,2-c]isoquinoline-5,11(4H,10H)-dione)
11. 2T (Dithiophene)
12. PC71BM (Poly(7,7-dimethyl-3,6-phenyl-1,10-phenanthroline))
13. Random terpolymers (Comprised of thieno[2′,3′ : 5′,6′]pyrido[3,4-g]-thieno[3,2-c]isoquinoline-5,11(4H,10H)-dione, thiophene, and dithiophene)

Note: Some of the materials have been mentioned multiple times in the paragraph, but I have listed them only once under their respective property names.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Of course! Here are the relevant entities from the text that refer to property names of materials:

1. P3HT (Poly(3-hexylthiophene))
2. PCBM (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene))
3. PTBT (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythieno[3,4-c]pyrrole))
4. PBT (Poly(3-bromothieno[3,4-c]pyrrole))
5. PTT (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythieno[3,4-c]thiophene))
6. PSeBDDIDT (Poly(selenophene-co-benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c′]dithiophene-4,8-dione))
7. PThBDDIDT (Poly(thieno[2′,3′ : 5′,6′]pyrido[3,4-g]-thieno[3,2-c]isoquinoline-5,11(4H,10H)-dione-co-benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c′]dithiophene-4,8-dione))

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| --- |
| P3HT (Poly(3-hexylthiophene)) |
| PCBM (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene)) |
| PTBT (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythieno[3,4-c]pyrrole)) |

| PTT (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythieno[3,4-c]thiophene)) |
| PSeBDDIDT (Poly(selenophene-co-benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c′]dithiophene-4,8-dione)) |
| PThBDDIDT (Poly(thieno[2′,3′ : 5′,6′]pyrido[3,4-g]-thieno[3,2-c]isoquinoline-5,11(4H,10H)-dione-co-benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c′]dithiophene-4,8-dione)) |

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Such high energy alignment would not enable to achieve a large open - circuit voltage and is eventually detrimental to the PCE output of PT - based PSCs such as in P3HT / PCBM systems with PCE ranging from 3 to 4% . 21,22 Geng and co-workers synthesized two PT - based donor materials by incorporating carboxylate side chains and vinylene linkers between thiophene units. The HOMO and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels of the resulting polymers , PBT and PTT , were substantially stabilized when compared to those of the parent P3HT. Such energy level lowering was attributed to the integration of carboxylate and vinylene groups giving rise to a push - pull structural motif , resulting in an enhanced PCE of the PV devices based on them. 21 Over the years , the use of the structural effect to enhance PSC performance has been extensively investigated , particularly the donor - acceptor ( D-A ) strategy , which has been proved to be an effective approach to develop donor polymers with wide absorption , low - lying energy levels , and enhanced electron properties. 23-32 Besides , conjugation expansion on the polymer backbone is an alternative tool to improve the electronic properties of polymers. By replacing a branched 2ethylhexyl side chain with a linear n-octyl group , Zhang and his co-workers synthesized a PTB7-Th derivative namely , PBTT. PV cells based on PBTT : IEICO showed a superior device performance than that of the PTB7-Th - based device with a PCE of 9.5% , a V oc of 0.86 V , a J sc of 17.9 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 61.3% . Such dramatic enhancement in efficiency was attributed to a higher charge mobility and improved morphology of the PBTT : IEICO blend film induced by the less steric hindered linear alkyl side chain. 1 Yang and coworkers used selenophene to replace thiophene π-bridge in the indacenodithiophene (IDT)-benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c′]dithiophene-4,8-dione (BDD)-based copolymer ( PThBDDIDT ) to develop a donor-π-acceptor type copolymer , PSeBDDIDT. The PCE of solar cells based on polymer : PC71BM as an active layer was dramatically increased from 7.04 to 8.65% , respectively. Such improvement could result from stronger intermolecular interactions , expanded absorption range , and better molecular planarity of selenophene contained PSeBDDIDT. 33 Random terpolymers comprised of thieno[2′,3′ : 5′,6′]pyrido [ 3,4- g]- thieno[3,2-c]isoquinoline-5,11(4H,10H)-dione , thiophene( T ) , and dithiophene ( 2T ) were synthesized by Yang and co-workers in which the crystallinity of terpolymers could be controlled by varying the compositions of T and 2T. The PSC based on a terpolymer with the optimized T / 2T ratio of 7 : 3 showed a high J sc of 18.3 mA cm^-2 and a FF of 71.2% , thus resulting in an enhanced PCE up to 10.8% . 34 Fluorination on polymer backbones has also been widely adopted to tune and improve the functional properties of donor polymers such as stabilization of their energy levels and hence positively impacting on PSC performance.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the values of the material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Open-circuit voltage (Voc):
 * Voc = 0.86 V (mentioned in the paragraph as the Voc of a PTB7-Th -based device)
 * Voc = 0.86 V (mentioned in the paragraph as the Voc of a PBTT : IEICO -based device)
2. Short-circuit current density (Jsc):
 * Jsc = 17.9 mA cm^-2 (mentioned in the paragraph as the Jsc of a PTB7-Th -based device)
 * Jsc = 17.9 mA cm^-2 (mentioned in the paragraph as the Jsc of a PBTT : IEICO -based device)
3. Fill factor (FF):
 * FF = 61.3% (mentioned in the paragraph as the FF of a PTB7-Th -based device)
 * FF = 61.3% (mentioned in the paragraph as the FF of a PBTT : IEICO -based device)
4. Power conversion efficiency (PCE):
 * PCE = 7.04% (mentioned in the paragraph as the PCE of a PThBDDIDT -based device)
 * PCE = 8.65% (mentioned in the paragraph as the PCE of a PSeBDDIDT -based device)
 * PCE = 9.5% (mentioned in the paragraph as the PCE of a PBTT : IEICO -based device)
5. HOMO and LUMO energy levels:
 * HOMO energy level = 21,22 Geng and co-workers synthesized two PT - based donor materials by incorporating carboxylate side chains and vinylene linkers between thiophene units. (mentioned in the paragraph)
 * LUMO energy level = The HOMO and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO) energy levels of the resulting polymers, PBT and PTT, were substantially stabilized when compared to those of the parent P3HT. (mentioned in the paragraph)
6. Conjugation length:
 * Conjugation length = By replacing a branched 2ethylhexyl side chain with a linear n-octyl group, Zhang and his co-workers synthesized a PTB7-Th derivative namely, PBTT. (mentioned in the paragraph)
7. Side chain type:
 * Side chain type = carboxylate side chains and vinylene linkers (mentioned in the paragraph)
8. Molecular weight:
 * Molecular weight = Not mentioned in the paragraph.

Note: The values mentioned in the paragraph are for different devices and materials, and they may not be directly comparable due to differences in the experimental conditions and the specific materials used.
